item.title: Can someone actually help me!
item.dc:creator: @billynom8s billynom8s
item.description:
@billynom8s wrote:

omfg noobs :::: joke ::: ok find the object for spinning wheel and then go down to the create object section :: then type

case ####: THATS THE OBJECT NUMBER

       if (objectX == #### && objectY == ####){
        setAnimation(862);
        deleteItem(1779, getItemSlot(1779), 1);
        addItem(1777, 1);
        addSkillXP(1000, 10);
        break;

there that should work… no need to put it in the client thats a verry odd way of welll theres no point in doing that
btw its all in the client .java

item.title: Can someone actually help me!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:9, topic:264291”][quote author=hailmerrypks7 link=topic=349021.msg2683777#msg2683777 date=1235530880]
It says that the “useItemID” and “atObjectID” might not have been initialized…

[/quote]Then initialize them. If you do not understand this term, I suggest learning the fundamentals of Java before continuing to program your server.[/quote]

hailmerrypks7:

It says that the “useItemID” and “atObjectID” might not have been initialized…

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/javaOO/initial.html

Check that out for size.

Something along the line’s of…

int useItemID = inStream.readUnsignedWord();
int atObjectID = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();

Read full topic
